summary: This is a formal letter from the law firm Steptoe & Johnson LLP, on behalf of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, to the Metropolitan Correctional Center's Legal Department. It requests specific documents and records related to Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019, citing serious irregularities and the need for an independent investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The client represented by the law firm; died in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019, while awaiting trial on federal charges.

persons.name: Michael C. Miller
persons.context: Attorney from Steptoe & Johnson LLP who authored the letter, representing Epstein's estate in requesting evidence related to his death.

persons.name: Martin G. Weinberg
persons.context: Attorney from Martin G. Weinberg, P.C., co-counsel on the letter, also representing Epstein's estate in the evidence request.

persons.name: William P. Barr
persons.context: Cited in the letter for his public statements acknowledging serious irregularities at the MCC and demanding a thorough investigation into Epstein's death.

connections.description: Miller, as an attorney at Steptoe & Johnson, is representing Epstein's estate in seeking evidence related to his death.
Weinberg is co-counsel, also representing Epstein's estate in the formal evidence request to the MCC.
Both are attorneys jointly representing Epstein's estate and are signatories on the same legal correspondence.
As Attorney General, Barr publicly commented on the serious questions and irregularities surrounding Epstein's death in federal custody.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center at approximately 6:30 a.m. He was transported to a hospital and pronounced dead.

events.title: Barr's Statement on Irregularities
events.description: Attorney General William P. Barr stated that serious irregularities at the MCC had been learned, demanding a thorough investigation.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died by an apparent suicide in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on the morning of August 10, 2019.
Epstein's estate, through his attorneys, is formally requesting specific evidence from the MCC for the period covering his death, including video recordings, entry/exit logs, and guard logs.
Attorney General William P. Barr publicly acknowledged 'serious irregularities' at the MCC facility following Epstein's death.
The FBI was investigating the incident at the time of this letter.
The New York City Office of Chief Medical Examiner initially delayed releasing a determination on the cause and manner of death, citing a need for further information.
